documentation.text:
@dev This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.
      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.

@dev This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.
      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.

@dev This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.
      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.
@dev It returns the root value of the tree
@dev It returns the size of the tree
@dev It returns the hash value of a node for the given position. Note that the index starts from 1
@dev It returns a merkle proof for a leaf. Note that the index starts from 1

documentation.text: @dev It returns true when the given params verifies that the given value exists in the tree or reverts the transaction.

@dev It returns the hash a parent node with hash(M | Left child | Right child)
      M is the index of the node

@dev it returns the hash of a leaf node with hash(M | DATA )
      M is the index of the node
@dev It returns the height of the highest peak
@dev It returns the height of the index
@dev It returns whether the index is the leaf node or not
@dev It returns the children when it is a parent node

@dev It returns all peaks of the smallest merkle mountain range tree which includes
      the given index(size)

@dev It returns the hash value of the node for the index.
      If the hash already exists it simply returns the stored value. On the other hand,
      it computes hashes recursively downward.
      Only appending an item calls this function

@dev This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.
      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.

documentation.text: @dev It returns true when the given params verifies that the given value exists in the tree or reverts the transaction.

      M is the index of the node

@dev it returns the hash of a leaf node with hash(M | DATA )
      M is the index of the node
@dev It returns the height of the highest peak
@dev It returns the height of the index
@dev It returns whether the index is the leaf node or not
@dev It returns the children when it is a parent node

@dev It returns all peaks of the smallest merkle mountain range tree which includes

devdoc.author: Wanseob Lim <email@wanseob.com>
devdoc.details: The index of this MMR implementation starts from 1 not 0.      And it uses keccak256 for its hash function instead of blake2b

append(MMR.Tree storage,bytes).details: This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.

appendHash(MMR.Tree storage,bytes32).details: This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.

getChildren(uint256).details: It returns the children when it is a parent node

getMerkleProof(MMR.Tree storage,uint256).details: It returns a merkle proof for a leaf. Note that the index starts from 1

getNode(MMR.Tree storage,uint256).details: It returns the hash value of a node for the given position. Note that the index starts from 1

getPeakIndexes(uint256).details: It returns all peaks of the smallest merkle mountain range tree which includes      the given index(size)

getRoot(MMR.Tree storage).details: It returns the root value of the tree

getSize(MMR.Tree storage).details: It returns the size of the tree

hashBranch(bytes32,bytes32).details: It returns the hash a parent node with hash(M | Left child | Right child)      M is the index of the node

hashLeaf(uint256,bytes32).details: it returns the hash of a leaf node with hash(M | DATA )      M is the index of the node

heightAt(uint256).details: It returns the height of the index

inclusionProof(bytes32,uint256,uint256,b.details: It returns true when the given params verifies that the given value exists in the tree or reverts the transaction.

isLeaf(uint256).details: It returns whether the index is the leaf node or not

mountainHeight(uint256).details: It returns the height of the highest peak

updateTree(MMR.Tree storage,bytes32).details: This only stores the hashed value of the leaf.      If you need to retrieve the detail data later, use a map to store them.

devdoc.title: Merkle Mountain Range solidity library
